communications.subject: Maryland Public Information Act Request: Baltimore City detention records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Detention records for any adults booked, incarcerated, or received at any detention facility in Baltimore City (including but not limited to Baltimore Central Booking and Intake Center, Chesapeake Detention Facility, Maryland Reception, Diagnostic and Classification Center, and Metropolitan Transition Center) pre-conviction or post-conviction at any point within the following three time periods:

- 10/01/2018-11/15/2018
- 10/01/2020-11/15/2020
- 10/01/2022-11/15/2022

For each record, I specifically request the following data (as available):

- Full name and alias(es)
- Birthdate
- Race/ethnicity (as available)
- Sex
- Booking number
- State or other identification numbers
- Facility (or facilities if multiple)
- Arresting agency
- Received date/time
- Release date/time
- Type of release (eg bail, ROR, etc)
- Last known address
- Initial charge description
- Initial charge statute
- Charging agency
- Final charge statute (if available)
- Court case number(s)
- Bail information
- Custody status (e.g., pretrial, sentenced, etc)
- Any other relevant case/charge information

I recognize that some of these data points may not available for some or all records, so please identify which are not available. Additionally, for those individuals who have multiple custody stints within the three periods, I request records for each custody stint. If any part of this request is unclear or I could provide additional information, please contact me.

The requested records are for academic research purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Stewart, Ph.D.
University of Maryland

title: Building Automation System Service Requests with date of request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Building Automation System Service Requests with date of request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am asking for the same data as my previous request (text below); but **also including** the date/time of submission, any unique identifiers generated by the form, and any other metadata related to these requests which CPS tracks (for example a status, like "accepted", "in progress", "rejected", "resolved"; connected work tickets; assigned engineers; notes, etc).

------
All BAS Service Requests submitted through the BAS Service Request Form from the beginning of 2019 through the present.
Requested data includes but is not limited to:
facility, requestor, requestor email, requester role / association with the school, description of the issue, "is this an emergency" and uploaded files.
Please supply the responses in a spreadsheet.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Moser
